column1: Yaws is a long-term (chronic) infection that mainly affects the skin, bones, and joints.
Yaws is an infection caused by a form of the Treponema pallidum bacteria.
It is closely related to the bacterium that causes syphilis, but this disease is not sexually transmitted.
Yaws mainly affects children in rural, warm, tropical areas, such as, Africa, Western Pacific islands, and Southeast Asia.
Other symptoms include: - Bone pain - Scarring of the skin - Swelling of the bones and fingers In the advanced stage, sores on the skin and bones can lead to severe disfigurement and disability.
However, the blood test for syphilis is often positive in people with yaws because the bacteria that cause these two conditions are closely related.
It can also cause deformities of the legs, nose, palate, and upper jaw.
